message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to discuss the product with you. It's a unique opportunity to get your hands on a valuable item. I'm willing to offer it to you for $12000. I believe this is a fair price considering its worth to you.
I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9000. I believe that's a fair price considering the product's value to me.

I understand your concerns about the price, Bob. However, I believe the product's value is still higher than what you're offering. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $11000. This is a compromise that I think is reasonable considering the product's worth to you.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit far from the price I'm comfortable with. I'd be willing to meet you at $10000. I think that's a fair price considering the product's value to me.

I understand your concerns, Bob, and I'm willing to make another concession. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $11500. This is the lowest price I'm willing to accept, considering the product's value to you.

I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'd be willing to meet you at $10500. I think that's a fair price considering the product's value to me.
I'm getting close to the minimum price I'm willing to accept, Bob. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $11250. This is my final concession, and I'm not willing to go any lower.

I appreciate your final concession, but I'm still not willing to pay $11250. I'd be willing to meet you at $10500, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. I think that's a fair price considering the product's value to me.

I'm not willing to sell the product at $10500, Bob. I've already made significant concessions, and I'm not willing to give away the product at a loss. I'm willing to sell it to you for $12000, which is the lowest price I'm willing to accept.
I'm not willing to pay $12000, and I've used up all my rounds. I'm afraid I'll have to pass on this deal. I'll consider buying the product from John for $15000 instead.
